docs.title: Plotpp
docs.text:
A plotting library for C++ that uses Gnuplot as a backend. Allows plotting from custom containers/vectors if they use begin() and end() iterators as well as plotting from built in arrays.

Documentation

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Gnuplot: Homepage{ data-preview } Windows Download Linux install: Note: The project can be build without gnuplot, since this library will only communicate with gnuplot through pipes. But you will need gnuplot to display the graphical plots.
  • C++20

docs.title: Dependencies
docs.text:
• {fmt}: GitHub, Documentation, Conan

A conan recipe is provided

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: You can see all examples in the examples/ folder.

docs.title: Line Plot
docs.text:
int main() {
    using namespace plotpp;

    {
        std::vector<double> x(20);
        for(size_t i=0; i < x.size(); ++i) x[i] = i;

        std::vector<double> y1(20);
        for(size_t i=0; i < y1.size(); ++i) y1[i] = 1./i*30;

        Figure fig("Line Plot from XY");
        fig.add(line(&x, &y1).label("1/x*30"));
        fig.show();
    }
}

docs.title: CMake
docs.text:
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.15)
project(PROJECT_NAME CXX)

find_package(plotpp CONFIG REQUIRED)

add_executable(main src/main.cpp)
target_link_libraries(main plotpp::plotpp)

docs.title: Conan Package Manager
docs.text:
Note: not yet added to the ConanCenter

conanfile.txt 

[requires]
plotpp/<version>

[generators]
CMakeDeps
CMakeToolchain

[layout]
cmake_layout

conanfile.py 

from conan import ConanFile
from conan.tools.cmake import cmake_layout


class ExampleRecipe(ConanFile):
    settings = "os", "compiler", "build_type", "arch"
    generators = "CMakeDeps", "CMakeToolchain"

    def requirements(self):
        self.requires("plotpp/<version>")

    def layout(self):
        cmake_layout(self)

build instructions with conan 

# install dependencies
conan install . --build=missing --output-folder build

# generate build scripts (for the build tool e.g.: -G "Ninja Multi-Config")
cmake -S . -B build -DBUILD_EXAMPLES=ON -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=build/Release/generators/conan_toolchain.cmake

# build the project
cmake --build build_gcc --config Release

docs.title: Conan FAQ
docs.text:
• How can I make Conan use a different CMake generator? Add to your profile: 
    [conf]
tools.cmake.cmaketoolchain:generator=Ninja
  • Conan selects the wrong compiler? Add to your profile: 
    [conf]
tools.build:compiler_executables={"c" : "gcc", "cpp" : "g++"}
  • Where can I find the default profile? 
    conan profile path default
  • I want to create a library but with conan create . --build=missing it cannot find the header files Enable transitive headers in your conanfile.py: 
    def requirements(self):
    self.requires("<library/version>", transitive_headers=True)

docs.title: Manually with add_subdirectory
docs.text:
Manually download the library and add it via add_subdirectory. 

add_subdirectory(path/to/Plotpp)
add_executable(PROJECT_NAME main.cpp)
target_link_libraries(YOUR_PROJECT_NAME PUBLIC plotpp)
Note: you would also need to add and link against fmt

docs.title: Manual Build
docs.text:
• include the folder containing plotpp.hpp
  • compile and link all *.cpp files in plotpp/

docs.title: function close
docs.text:
void close()

closes this figure. following calls to show() will thus create a new window. closes the pipe stream to the curren figure / gnuplot scession;

docs.title: Plotting Styles
docs.text:
There will be more in the future - promise.

Line Plot Point Plot

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
#include <vector>
#include <plotpp.hpp>

int main() {
    // create data
    std::vector<double> y(20);
    for(size_t i=0; i < y.size(); ++i) y[i] = i*i;

    // create figure
    Figure fig("Line Plot from Y");
    fig.add(line(std::move(y)).label("x^2").color(0.8, 0.1, 0.1));
    fig.show();

    return 0;
}

docs.title: Construction
docs.text:
Create a line from y-values only. Accepts non-owning raw pointers and moved containers with begin() and end() iterators. 

template<PtrOrMoved Uy> auto line(Uy&& y)

Create a line from x and y-values. Accepts non-owning raw pointers and moved containers with begin() and end() iterators. Containers can be of different type. 

template<PtrOrMoved Ux, PtrOrMoved Uy> auto line(Ux&& x, Uy&& y)
